contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2013}} {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport|Women's [[Field hockey|Field Hockey]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{FRG}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalSilver|[[1984 Summer Olympics|1984 Los Angeles]]|Team Competition}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Ursula ("Ulla") Thielemann''' (born January 9, 1960) was a [[field hockey]] international from [[West Germany]], who won the silver medal with her national squad at the [[1984 Summer Olympics]] in [[Los Angeles, California]]. She was the first [[goalkeeper]] in women's field hockey to wear a [[helmet]]. {{Citation needed|date=June 2010}} ==References== * [http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/th/ulla-thielemann-1.html sports-reference] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Thielemann, Ursula | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Field hockey player | DATE OF BIRTH = January 9, 1960 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Thielemann, Ursula}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:German field hockey players]] [[Category:Olympic field hockey players of West Germany]] [[Category:Olympic silver medalists for West Germany]] [[Category:Field hockey players at the 1984 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in field hockey]] {{Germany-fieldhockey-Olympic-medalist-stub}}
